Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object

    Map

    Purpose - to create a map class that is safe to share with other developers

    Note: This is a modified version of Prof. Vybihal's code.

    Since:
    October 2018
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Joseph Vybihal, Aidan Wadin

    • Field Summary

      private int height

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Map(int width, int height)
      Constructor builds a safe world as per instructions Throws error if it cannot be created.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns a formatted string representing all the values in the map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        Map(int width,
    int height)
throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor builds a safe world as per instructions Throws error if it cannot be created.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the generated map
        height - Height of the generated map
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Makes sure all values are properly assigned

    • Method Detail

      • validSize

        public static boolean validSize(int n)
        Public static methods to be used by external software to validate their data without the need to instantiate an object This method Checks to make sure the user input value for the dimensions of the array are greater than 0
        Parameters:
        n - The input value
        Returns:
        boolean Whether or not the input value is valid or not (aka greater than 0)

      • validTerrain

        public static boolean validTerrain(char c)
        This method makes sure the user input character is valid to be put into the map
        Parameters:
        c - The user input char
        Returns:
        boolean Whether or not this symbol is valid

      • setTerrain

        public void setTerrain(int row,
                       int col,
                       char terrain)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Safe public method to populate the map. It also allows updated to be made by the user in later steps after initial creation This is a versatile method that can be applied to many steps of the problem without needing to re-code something
        Parameters:
        row - Which row of the map will be altered
        col - Which column of the map will be altered
        terrain - What symbol will be put at this row, col coordinate
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Makes sure all input values are allowed, if they are not the program gracefully handles the problem by throwing this exception

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a formatted string representing all the values in the map.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
